item.title: The virtual and the physical: The growth of social media data on places, and its implications
item.description: Into the city In the past, people walked the streets and left no trace. This is no longer true. We are creating large amounts of data about the places around us: how we move through them, and how they move us. One source of this data has been the growth in smart phone and social media use.[1] The geotagged social media data generated by phones and cameras is producing information on a large number of peopleâ€™s interactions with their surroundings.
